question: What is the name of the principle used to describe data that identifies or could identify a person?
Explain the difference between lossless and lossy compression and give an example of each.
answer: lossless: reduces size without losing information (example: PNG, ZIP); lossy: reduces size by discarding some information (example: JPEG, MP3)
lossless compression keeps all original data so it can be perfectly reconstructed (e.g. ZIP, PNG); lossy compression discards some data for higher compression (e.g. JPEG, MP3)
